title: Foreign Trade Competition Has Hurt Black and Disadvantaged Workers Most, Report Says
description: A government trade agency report suggested that the impact of trade policy differed for workers depending on their race and socioeconomic status.

title: Poland Calls a Crisis Meeting After Grain Plant Explosion Near Ukraine Border
description: The plant lies just a few miles from the border with Ukraine, and the explosion reported there came on the same day that Russia launched a widespread missile attack on Ukraine.

title: At G20 Summit, Xi and Biden Offer Rival Visions for Solving Global Issues
description: China and the United States showed how global summits are an arena for great powers to compete, with implications for the war in Ukraine and Asia’s future.

title: Missile Fragment Brings Terror and Death to Kyiv Apartment Building
description: Residents told of a frantic escape: “We were just running around, no idea what to do,” one said.

title: G20 Leaders Urge an End to the Russia-Ukraine War
description: World leaders gathering in Indonesia said their nations faced challenges from conflict and economic headwinds.

title: UK Pledges $1.19 Billion to Fight Diseases in Poor Countries
description: The contribution to the Global Fund is less than aid organizations had hoped for. Britain has been cutting foreign aid since 2020.

title: Xi Addresses China-Australia Relationship With Prime Minister Albanese
description: The meeting between the leaders of China and Australia during the Group of 20 summit was another sign that Beijing is looking more broadly to ease diplomatic rifts with Western countries.

title: Colombia Leads a New Latin American Left Into the Climate Fight
description: The country’s first leftist president says oil is his economy’s worst addiction. Phasing it out would be a global first for a major oil producer.

title: World Population Reaches 8 Billion, UN Says
description: The rapid population growth has been driven by the world’s poorest countries. More global challenges are ahead.

title: Alaa Abd El Fattah Ends Hunger Strike in Egypt, Family Says
description: During the U.N. climate conference in Egypt, world leaders pressed the Egyptian president to release Alaa Abd El Fattah, who has been on a hunger strike for more than seven months.

title: In Brazil, Lula Beat Bolsonaro. Now Comes the Hard Part.
description: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva had one of Latin America’s best presidencies ever in the century’s first decade. His second try looks far more difficult.

title: War and Food Insecurity Are Focus at G20 Summit
description: G20 leaders gather in Indonesia, a day after President Biden and China’s Xi Jinping said their nations faced challenges from conflict and economic headwinds.

title: As U.K. Braces for Painful Budget Cuts, the Mood Is Gloomy
description: Swindon, west of London, has reinvented itself several times, always a rung lower on the economic ladder. Now it awaits another step down.

title: Reopened Rail Route in Ukraine Restores Some Order
description: On Monday night, the first train from Kyiv departed for the Black Sea city, which had been pummeled for months by Russian attacks.

title: Palestinian Assailant Kills 3 Israelis in West Bank
description: The attack began in a settlement industrial zone and continued along a highway, and took place on the day that Israel is to swear in a new Parliament.

title: Trump’s Precarious Moment
description: He’s expected to announce his third White House run at a time when he is politically vulnerable.

title: What Is the G20?
description: The Group of 20 nations aims to unite world leaders around shared challenges. Here is a look at what it is and what it does.

title: In Poland, a Warm Welcome for Ukrainian Refugees Wobbles
description: Poland took in millions of people fleeing the war in Ukraine. But a vocal minority is trying to stoke tensions as Russian attacks threaten to prompt a new surge.

title: Ukraine’s 15,000-Mile Lifeline
description: How the country’s vast rail system has helped it withstand an invasion.

title: Is Rock Climbing the Future of Tourism in Malawi?
description: The small country in southeastern Africa is leveraging its little-known rock cliffs and boulders to develop local interest in climbing — and to draw adventure tourists.

title: World Leaders Meet as Global Economy Faces Multiple Threats
description: High inflation, food insecurity and a possible global recession loom large as the Group of 20 summit discussions begin.

title: Novak Djokovic Is Cleared to Play in Australian Open
description: Australia has lifted the tennis star’s three-year ban on entering the country, imposed when he was deported in January over his failure to be vaccinated for Covid.

title: As Britain Braces for Painful Budget Cuts, the Mood Is Gloomy
description: Swindon, west of London, has reinvented itself several times, always a rung lower on the economic ladder. Now it awaits another step down.

title: Bringing Sexy Back — To Fight H.I.V.
description: Most safer sex campaigns focus on danger and disease. Acknowledging the importance of pleasure — and how to make safe sex good sex — could make them more effective.

title: Beijing Signals Optimism for U.S. Ties After Biden-Xi Meeting
description: An upbeat photo in China’s main newspaper and comments by the foreign minister suggested that Beijing believes its relationship with Washington could improve.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Dozens of young people have died in a lethal crackdown by the authorities in Iran.

title: Western Allies Look to Ukraine as a Testing Ground for Weapons
description: Though the battle for Ukraine remains largely a grinding artillery war, new advances in technology and training there are being closely monitored for the ways they are starting to shape combat.

title: Hun Sen of Cambodia Cuts G20 Trip Short After Testing Positive for Covid
description: The prime minister has met with more than a dozen world leaders in recent days, including President Biden, who tested negative on Tuesday.

title: Accounts of Torture Emerge From Kherson, Ukraine’s ‘City of Fear’
description: Just days after the southern city of Kherson was liberated after eight months of Russian occupation, accounts of beatings, torture and disappearances are emerging.
